label: A_oC8_64_f-002
title: Black Phosphorus ($A17$) Structure
comments:
Phosphorus is found in at least three forms: \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oC8_64_f-002}{Black phosphorus, {\em Strukturbericht} $A17$}, (this structure) \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mP84_13_21g-001}{Monoclinic Hittorf's phosphorus}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_aP24_2_12i-001}{Low temperature triclinic ``white'' phosphorus}, stable below 197K. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oC8_64_f-001}{$\alpha$-gallium ($A11$)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oC8_64_f-003}{molecular iodine ($A14$)}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oC8_64_f-002}{black phosphorous ($A17$)} all share the same AFLOW label, A\_oC8\_64\_f. The structures are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
